intro: Gamochlamys heterandra, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and attractive species for botanical gardens.
